description.narrative: The IRQJR3 has two Strategic Objectives (SO1 and SO2): Objective 1: To alleviate human suffering through the effective and efficient implementation of humanitarian response activities by the Dutch NGOs. Objective 2: To generate collaborative impact through the collaboration between the IRQJR3 members and other stakeholders.

The project will focus mainly on newly displaced women and children from Mosul (90% of the beneficiaries, excluding information dissemination which will reach entire population). These highly vulnerable groups are currently unable to access (stigma-free) psychosocial care, GBV counseling, and protection assistance in the camps. Children in the camps are often deprived of save places to play, of ways to process their trauman and of their childhood in general. Through the save spaces trauma counselling will be provided in a playful manner. Specific attention will be paid to adolescent girls extra vulnerable for human right abuses as well has female- and child headed households who often face severe protection issues.

World Vision's programme will contribute to the following objectives: Protection, Specific Objective 1: First line response: Provide immediate protection support to highly at-risk populations, including to people in difficult-to-reach and unstable environment. Protection, Specific Objective 2: Second line response: Provide specialized support to populations suffering from abuse and violence and facilitate community-based support for families and people affected by the conflict and engage with authorities and humanitarian partners to promote full adherence to international protection norms
